snippet: A selling spree by large mutual funds has raised concerns among regulators and economists about a broader contagion if investors start to ask for their money at the same time.
abstract: Large mutual funds that have contributed to rapid growth in developing countries have begun hastily abandoning those investments, driven in part by China's devaluation of its currency; investors, unnerved by trend many have come to view as unsustainable, have pulled $2.5 billion from market bond funds in course of one week, contributing to dramatic drop in global markets.
lead_paragraph: A selling spree by large mutual funds has raised concerns among regulators and economists about a broader contagion if investors start to ask for their money at the same time.

headline.main: Investors Race to Escape Risk in Once-Booming Emerging-Market Bonds
headline.print_headline: Investors Race to Escape Risk in Global Bonds
